review: I am surprised why I am not hearing this complaint more. Or may be it happens only in the piece I bought on Cyber Monday for $69?After I bought it, the remote drained three sets of batteries in three weeks. And it was only used a few times a week. I spoke to customer service and they said it was a known issue. They offered to give a $10 discount if I bought rechargeable batteries and a charger from them, which I had to do because I wasn't going to buy a new set of batteries every week. Now the rechargeable batteries run out every 3 days. Every time I want to use it I have to replace the batteries first. This has been a total absolute disaster. I very much wanted to like it but I don't.

review: I looked at the Roku 3 and the Amazon Fire TV for my second TV.  I already have a Roku 3 in the living room and we like it a lot. However, after reading some reviews about the Amazon Fire TV, decided to give it a try, plus they offered $20 off.  When it arrived, we hooked it up, signed in, and started looking around.  Have to say it a pretty nice device but the lack of support for external media is making me pack it up and send it back.  The fact that you cannot read a flash drive or external hard drive through the USB port is not cool.  So, I'll be ordering another Roku 3.If we didn't need that feature, I would most definitely keep it!

review: I really like the interface and the controls, BUT there should be more Television included on Prime. When I bought it I was looking forward to watching shows like "The Facts of Life", "The Partridge Family", or "Sliders". Spending $200.00 ($100.00 for an Amazon Prime Membership, and than $100.00 for the Fire TV itself) to only see that some of your favorite shows are not on Prime...this is highly disappointing. Your negotiators that work with the studios to place shows on to Prime need to work tougher or your going to start to loose customers to other streaming devices.Another large issue you need to address is the way ones TV shows, Movies, and Documentaries are displayed in the "Watch List". Simply having selections ordered as most recent first is inferior. One should be able to organize Alphabetically, or to make folders according to genre, and then to alphabetize within said folders.Add more TV shows to Prime and give the user total control over how items are arranged and these actions will help to raise Amazon Fire TV about the competition.
